text: I think the first rule for anyone if you
want to be healthier to stop drinking
your sugar anyone wants to clean up
their diet as I really say let's get rid
of the sweetened beverages it's just not
compatible with maintaining a healthy
weight and maintaining overall health
people will do like a juice during the
day because they think it's healthy or a
lot of these sort of like sweetened iced
teas that are claiming they're high in
antioxidants and probiotics and things
like that but frankly it's just added
sugar in a really concentrated form I
think one of the biggest traps people
fall into when they want to eat well and
make good choices for themselves is that
three four o'clock dip in blood sugar
when they're starving and that doesn't
happen spontaneously at four o'clock
that starts at breakfast and what
happens is when people wake up and they
try to skimp on breakfast and be really
good for their lunch at three o'clock it
all goes out the window
because your blood sugar gets super low
you get super hungry and what do you
crave sugar carbee you know sweet
indulgent food you can't say no to the
bread basket you overeat portions of
things like pasta and rice and that's
really this cycle that can perpetuate
being overweight and having a hard time
getting a handle on your diet and so
what I really focus on with my clients
is getting that first half of the day
right making sure that you are eating a
satiating breakfast a satiating balanced
lunch so that by the time 4 o'clock
rolls around by the time dinner rolls
around you may be pica SH and a little
bit hungry but you're not ready to tear
someone's head off because once you are
that hungry all bets are off and you
can't make good choices for yourself
you
